definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Vos voyaged to Coruscant to kill Senator Kaa, but Windu stopped Vos in time.
sentences.chinese: 昆蘭前往科洛桑暗殺卡議員，所幸被溫杜及時制止。

sentences.english: I tipped the bottle over carelessly, but luckily it was not broken.
sentences.chinese: 我不小心將瓶子弄倒了，所幸沒摔碎。

sentences.english: Fortunately, either of these difficulties is easily overcome with a little thought and preparation.
sentences.chinese: 所幸這些難題只要花些巧思和準備就可輕易克服解決。

sentences.english: Luckily, a computer can do this kind of computing in a few seconds.
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，計算機在幾秒內就可以完成這類計算。

sentences.english: At one point an ice floe the team's tent was moored on broke apart, although no one was injured.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，隊伍帳篷所在的浮冰破裂，所幸無人受傷。

sentences.english: Fortunately, there is a range of products available to treat the symptoms of hay fever .
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，有一系列的產品可供治療的症狀，花粉症。

sentences.english: She got a bump on her head when she fell down, but luckily she wasn't hurt.
sentences.chinese: 她摔倒時頭被撞了一下，所幸沒有受傷。

sentences.english: Fortunately, you can use them both together.
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，這兩種項目都可以使用。

sentences.english: Fortunately, this is a borrower's market.
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，現在是借方的市場。

sentences.english: Fortunately, my kids are phasing out of the Wiggles’ music. It’s brutally catchy!
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，我的小孩正逐漸脫離他們的音樂。

sentences.english: Fortunately, it was now near evening and the seven dwarfs came home.
sentences.chinese: 所幸這時天快黑了，小矮人們也回到家來。

sentences.english: Fortunately, you don't have to be particularly intelligent or well educated to think independently.
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，獨立思考並不需要智力超羣或學富五車。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the experience of the Japanese mice suggests that this won't happen.
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，日本的老鼠實驗表明了上述情況不會發生。

sentences.english: Fortunately, there is a way to manage this situation.
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，有一種辦法可以應付這種情況。

sentences.english: Lucky for me I did well in the finals despite not doing a day of study.
sentences.chinese: 所幸即使沒再學一天功課，統考的成績也不差。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the American people do not want this to happen.
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，美國人民不希望這種事情發生。

definition: to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to be more scared than hurt (idiom)/to get through a daunting experience without mishap
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
